intro: Symbolanthus yaviensis, commonly known as the Yaviensis symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
